alert.note: Alert for Chatham; Durham; Orange; Wake (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued January 03 at 8:10AM EST until January 03 at 9:15AM EST by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 915 AM EST THIS MORNING FOR NORTHEASTERN CHATHAM, SOUTHERN DURHAM, SOUTHEASTERN ORANGE AND WAKE COUNTIES... At 810 AM EST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain and thunderstorms producing heavy rain in the Triangle. Around 1 inch of rain has fallen in the last hour. Additional rainfall amounts up to a half inch are possible in the warned area through 915 AM, although rain will steadily taper down from south to north. Flash flooding is already occurring, with numerous reports of flooded roads around the area. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Raleigh, Durham, Cary, Chapel Hill, Pittsboro, Wake Forest, Garner, Carrboro, RDU International, Apex, Holly Springs, Morrisville, Knightdale, Rolesville, Research Triangle, William B Umstead State Park, Carpenter, Parkwood, Bethesda and Lake Wheeler. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
